reviews.title: Brilliant
reviews.text: Club Selima is really good for relaxing and enjoying a break. the is alot to do the quad bikes a really good and the club at the hotel is good fun. the are lots of shows on at night and you can take part. I have been to the same hotel 7 times now, that must mean it is brilliant.

this hotel is first class more of a 4 star the rooms and sunbeds a bit outdated the staff are first class from the bell boys to entertainment team the food is a bit german related but you will find something to eat you wont go hungry you can eat from 9 until midnight the entertainment is ok if you like game shows a lot of ballroom dancing in between there are not many english but you will find them and make good friends hi there to adam from sheffield you will have a great holiday just be friendley to the staff it will go along way we will be sure going back again you will be amazed it is only 3 star as we was have fun everyone a t n a plus it is right on the beach the people are so friendley any questions please ask
reviews.title: superb holiday

reviews.text: Me and my daughter booked this trip on Wednesday and flew out on Saturday through best Sunshine. Kathargo air lines are very basic and the planes are old but the staff on the way out were superb. Transfers were great and quick. On arrival at Club Selima checkin was quick with staff who can speak several languages. There was a porter who took our bags to our room (please tip them). The bank stays open until 11pm in the hotel. The room was basic and clean and the maid kept it clean all week.
reviews.title: Cheap Holiday and good value

reviews.text: As this is all inclusive all meals are buffet style in a large dining room with a large outdoor patio area. Everything is clean and once you get used to where everything is you soon get the hang of it. The food however is mainly catered for the Cotinentals so no English fry up which we didnt mind. Plenty of salads, pastas, meats (although cheaper cuts of meat used) and the deserts are scrummy. When you go in the dining room for lunch a waiter showed us to our table and got us the drinks we wanted. We tipped the waiter then and always had our table saved, with different folded napkins and flowers all the week. Waiters work long hours here and 7 days a week. Food might not be geared up for some English taste buds - but you wont starve.
reviews.title: Fabulous Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bars - Drinks are only local and to be honest the spirits few and far between and are a bit on the harsh side.Entertainment was a bit old hat with mostly the same thing every night.
reviews.title: Mature English couple Warwicksire Uk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Accommodation is basic but clean, in beautifully kept grounds - all in small unit of 8-10 rooms. Food is reasonable, you can usually find something to eat but it could have been more varied. I don't know what the main breakfast is like as we never made it, as it finishes at 09:30, but you can get a coffee and bread/cheese and pastries up until 12:00 which is OK to keep you going until lunchtime. The animation team work very hard, if you're into all that stuff.
reviews.title: OK value, but too many rude Germans & Russians

reviews.text: Main gripe is the place is mostly Germans and Russians, and I've never come across such an ignorant bunch in my life. Also lots of young children around the pool, so if you don't want kids around this isn't the place for you.
reviews.title: dissasterous would not reccomend to us brits

reviews.text: It was cheap, the staff were mostly really nice and it was OK for the money, but I don't think I'd rush back. First time to Tunisia and if I was to return I think it would have to be 5*

reviews.text: Friendly hotel, on the beach of pure white sand and warm clear water. Large outside entertainment area, few shops on site selling the usual holiday items, Choice of places to eat from early morning till midnight. Staff were friendly and helpful, The whole complex had a relaxed comfortable atmosphere, We booked on Wednesday and went on the Saturday, slight delay at Gatwick and from Monastir(20mins) Food choice was large catering to all requirements. Wine and soft drinks included at lunch and evening meals which we ate on the terrace overlooking the sea,,,, we loved it and are going again this year....
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a week all inclusive at Club Selima and it is definitely value for money. We were met by porters who took our bags but we were dissapointed to see twin beds, went back to reception and they changed it straight away for a double no problem,
reviews.title: LOVELY HOLIDAY GREAT HOTEL & GREAT STAFF !!!!
friendly staff but smelly rooms
reviews.text: The food is more than adequate for a 3* hotel and we thought the steak at the a la carte was very good, the pizzas are to die for just a shame we had to wait until 10pm to get them!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We tipped the waiters on the first night and then every night we never had to wait for a drink, the drinks are quite limited only beer, wine, vodka, whisky or brandy and they did a cocktail that was pretty awful it was like drinking syrup but we were okay with the choice we had.
reviews.title: Looking for a cheap All Inclusive? - Get it booked !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last night the waiter had reserved our table and decorated it with fresh flowers, really nice touch.
reviews.title: a great place to relax

reviews.text: Lovely clean hotel 50 2 storey blocks of 10 all with terrace/balcony - room was fine for us 4 and was cleaned daily before 3 p.m. - you can eat from 6 - midnight and they made an effort to vary meals and it was always plentiful. 2 nippy outside pools with mattresses for sunbeds for 2 dinar (£1) staff were friendly - clean beach, watersports available and the animation team worked hard.
reviews.title: We enjoyed it very much & would Recommend

reviews.text: It is a 40 min. walk along the beach to PEK but only 4 dinar ( £2) in a cab anyway.and 7/8 dinar to go into Sousse.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An excellent three star hotel. We arrived very early season and the hotel was not fully open, but the welcome we received from all the staff was very warm and friendly. Choice of food was excellent with buffet style meals. There was no skimping with any of the drinks, although the selection of alcoholic is a little limited.
